channel.title: Is there anyway to add player rights? PI rep++
channel.description: I was wondering if there was a way to add player rights... e.g 0= Regular 1= Donator 2= Super Donator 3= Moderator 4= Admin 5= Developer 6= Co-owner 7= Owner Because that is exactly how I want mine to be :P thnx for help

@ZioBotic wrote:

its not hard, just on the command or w/e make it a high number that there is non like hidden mod or summ at so like just add 11 to the number and it wont be like a fusion of them. so regular : 11 no commands for them unless like home and then, you can go to your files and look through and find where it makes a character file change it to rights 11 not 0 and it will all work.

item.source: Is there anyway to add player rights? PI rep++

item.title: Is there anyway to add player rights? PI rep++
item.dc:creator: @mrpyro3 mrpyro3
item.description:
@mrpyro3 wrote:

[quote=“go armand, post:7, topic:406270”]you can do this. easy.
im pretty sure anyway.

say you wanted to make a player a super donator (4) was it?
you would open up their player document.
find ‘rights = 0’
then, replace 0 with 4.

that just means their rights are 4.

now open up your commands and find one that you want to make exclusive to superdonator
such as ::pnpc

if (cmd[0].equalsIgnoreCase("pnpc") && p.rights == 4) { p.npcType = (Integer.parseInt(cmd[1])); p.appearanceUpdateReq = true; p.updateReq = true; }

this means that only players saved with the rights ‘4’ can use the pnpc command.
you’re probs using a 317 source. (thats a 525 above) but its pretty easy to figure out.[/quote]
4 is usually a hidden mod or hidden admin, he wants to change that and add more. I’m pretty sure there is no way to do this but you can implement a new character token and call is something like “super donator”

Read full topic
item.source: Is there anyway to add player rights? PI rep++

item.title: Is there anyway to add player rights? PI rep++
item.dc:creator: @go_armand go armand
item.description:
@go_armand wrote:

you can do this. easy.
im pretty sure anyway.

say you wanted to make a player a super donator (4) was it?
you would open up their player document.
find ‘rights = 0’
then, replace 0 with 4.

that just means their rights are 4.

now open up your commands and find one that you want to make exclusive to superdonator
such as ::pnpc

if (cmd[0].equalsIgnoreCase("pnpc") && p.rights == 4) { p.npcType = (Integer.parseInt(cmd[1])); p.appearanceUpdateReq = true; p.updateReq = true; }

this means that only players saved with the rights ‘4’ can use the pnpc command.
you’re probs using a 317 source. (thats a 525 above) but its pretty easy to figure out.

EDIT just noticed its a pi server
EDIT 2. you can;t change peoples repp with a rep of 9, so dont advertise it.

Read full topic
